text: The Europe/Africa Zone is one of three zones of regional competition in the 2017 Fed Cup. == Group I == * Venue: Tallink Tennis Centre, Tallinn, Estonia (indoor hard) * Date: 8–11 February The fourteen teams were divided into two pools of three teams and two pools of four teams. The four pool winners took part in promotional play-offs to determine the two nations advancing to the World Group II Play-offs. The nations finishing last in their pools took part in relegation play-offs, with the two losing nations being relegated to Group II for 2018. Seeding: The seeding was based on the Fed Cup Rankings of 14 November 2016 (shown in parentheses below). {| class="wikitable" !width=30%|Pot 1 !width=30%|Pot 2 !width=40%|Pot 3 |- style="vertical- align:top" | | | |} === Pools === === Play-offs === {| |-valign=top | {| class=wikitable style="border:1px solid #AAAAAA;" |- !Placing!!A Team!!Score!!D Team |- |Promotional || ||align="center"|1–2 || '''''' |- |5th–8th || ' ||align="center"|2–1 || |- |9th ||colspan=2 || |- |Relegation || ' ||align="center"|2–1 || ' |} | {| class=wikitable style="border:1px solid #AAAAAA;" |- !Placing!!B Team!!Score!!C Team |- |Promotional || ||align="center"|1–2 || '''''' |- |5th–8th || ' ||align="center"|2–0 || |- |9th ||colspan=2 || |- |Relegation || ' ||align="center"|1–2 || ''' |} |} === Final placements === {| class=wikitable |- |- style="background: #E6E6FA;" | Placing | colspan="2" style="text-align:center"| Teams |- style="background: #ccffcc;" | Promoted/First | '''''' | '''''' |- | Third | | |- | Fifth | | |- | Seventh | | |- | Ninth | | |- | Eleventh | | |-style="background: #ffcccc;" | Relegated/Thirteenth | '''' | '''' |} * ' and ' were promoted to 2017 Fed Cup World Group II Play-offs * ' and ' were relegated to Europe/Africa Zone Group II in 2018 == Group II == * Venue: Šiauliai Tennis School, Šiauliai, Lithuania (indoor hard) * Date: 19–22 April The eight teams were divided into two pools of four teams. The two nations placing first and second took part in play-offs to determine the two nations advancing to Group I. The nations finishing third and last in their pools took part in relegation play-offs, with the two losing nations being relegated to Group III for 2018. Seeding: The seeding was based on the Fed Cup Rankings of 13 February 2017 (shown in parentheses below). {| class="wikitable" !width=25%|Pot 1 !width=25%|Pot 2 !width=25%|Pot 3 !width=25%|Pot 4 |- style="vertical-align:top" | | | | |} === Pools === === Play-offs === {| class=wikitable style="border:1px solid #AAAAAA;" |- !Placing!!A Team!!Score!!B Team |- |Promotional || ' ||align="center"|2–0 || |- |Promotional || ' ||align="center"|2–1|| |- |Relegation || ' ||align="center"|2–0 || ' |- |Relegation || ' ||align="center"|0–2 || ''' |} === Final placements === {| class=wikitable |- |- style="background: #E6E6FA;" | Placing | colspan="2" style="text- align:center"| Teams |- style="background: #ccffcc;" | Promoted/First | '''''' | '''''' |- | Third | | |- | Fifth | | |-style="background: #ffcccc;" | Relegated/Seventh | '''' | '''' |} * ' and ' were promoted to Europe/Africa Zone Group I in 2018 * ' and ' were relegated to Europe/Africa Zone Group III in 2018 == Group III == * Venue: National Tennis School & Tennis Club Acvila, Chișinău, Moldova (outdoor clay) * Date: 13–17 June The fifteen teams were divided into one pool of three teams and three pools of four teams. The four nations placing first took part in play-offs to determine the two nations advancing to Group II. Seeding: The seeding was based on the Fed Cup Rankings of 24 April 2017 (shown in parentheses below). {| class="wikitable" !width=25%|Pot 1 !width=25%|Pot 2 !width=25%|Pot 3 !width=25%|Pot 4 |- style="vertical-align:top" | | | | |} === Pools === === Play-offs === {| |-valign=top | {| class=wikitable style="border:1px solid #AAAAAA;" |- !Placing!!A Team!!Score!!C Team |- |Promotional || ' ||align="center"| 2–0 || |- |5th–8th || ' ||align="center"| 2–1 || |- |9th–12th || ||align="center"| 1–2 || '''''' |- |13th–14th || colspan=2 || |} | {| class=wikitable style="border:1px solid #AAAAAA;" |- !Placing!!B Team!!Score!!D Team |- |Promotional || ||align="center"| 0–2 || '''''' |- |5th–8th || ||align="center"| 1–2 || '''''' |- |9th–12th || ||align="center"| 0–2 || '''''' |- |13th–14th || ' ||align="center"| 3–0 || |} |} === Final placements === {| class=wikitable |- |- style="background: #E6E6FA;" | Placing | colspan="2" style="text-align:center"| Teams |- style="background: #ccffcc;" | Promoted/First | | |- | Third | | |- | Fifth | | |- | Seventh | | |- | Ninth | | |- | Eleventh | | |- | Thirteenth |colspan=2| |- | Fourteenth | | |} * ' and ' were promoted to Europe/Africa Zone Group II in 2018. == References == * Fed Cup Result, 2017 Europe/Africa Group I * Fed Cup Result, 2017 Europe/Africa Group II * Fed Cup Result, 2017 Europe/Africa Group III == External links == * Fed Cup website Europe Africa Category:Tennis tournaments in Estonia Category:Tennis tournaments in Lithuania Category:Tennis tournaments in Moldova
title: 2017 Fed Cup Europe/Africa Zone
